name: Trigonometry - Right triangle vertex from an angle
description: This tutorial will help you learn how to get the coordinates of a triangle vertex from its angle.

pages.textAfter: If the hypotenuse (r) is equal to 1, then x is cosΘ and y is sinΘ. This means that the coordinates of the top vertex are (x, y) or (cosΘ, sinΘ).

pages.textBefore: For example, if the angle is 30°, then the vertex is at (√3/2, 1/2) and if the angle is 45°, the vertex is at (√2/2, √2/2).
pages.textAfter: In kinematics, in order to get the position of the child node, build a right triangle using the angle of the link and get the vertex.

pages.textBefore: In this example, the angle is 45° and the position of the parent node is at the origin (0, 0).
pages.textAfter: To get the position of the child node, just add the position of the parent node to (cos(45°), sin(45°)). The position of the child node is (√2/2, √2/2)
